javadoc:
A root for system tests that provides known system information.

This class exists so that fast unit tests have a place to share data without having the slowness of more heavy weight concepts like {@link Application}, logging, etc.

!! WARNING !! This test is meant to initialize quickly. All file I/O should be avoided.

methods.name: createTestDirectoryPath
methods.comment:
Get the directory path within which all temporary test
 data files should be created.

return.comment: test directory path ending with a File.separator character

methods.name: assertArraysEqualOrdered
methods.comment:
Compares the contents of two arrays to determine if they are equal.  The contents must
 match in the same order. If message
 is null, then a generic error message will be printed.

params.name: message
params.comment: The message to print upon failure; can be null

params.name: expected
params.comment: The expected array.

params.name: actual
params.comment: The actual array.

methods.name: assertArraysEqualUnordered
methods.comment:
Compares the contents of two arrays to determine if they are equal.  The contents do not have
 to be in the same order.  If message
 is null, then a generic error message will be printed.

params.name: message
params.comment: The message to print upon failure; can be null

params.name: expected
params.comment: The expected array.

params.name: actual
params.comment: The actual array.

methods.name: assertArraysEqualUnordered
methods.comment: Compares the contents of two arrays to determine if they are equal

params.name: expected
params.comment: The expected array.

params.name: actual
params.comment: The actual array.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current test method name
@return the current test method name
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the current test method name

methods.name: waitFor
methods.comment: Waits for the given latch to be counted-down

params.name: latch
params.comment: the latch to await

methods.name: waitFor
methods.comment: Waits for the given condition to return true

params.name: condition
params.comment: the condition that returns true when satisfied

throws.comment: if the condition is not met within the timeout period

methods.name: waitForCondition
methods.comment: Waits for the given condition to return true

params.name: condition
params.comment: the condition that returns true when satisfied

throws.comment: if the condition is not met within the timeout period

methods.name: waitForCondition
methods.comment: Waits for the given condition to return true

params.name: condition
params.comment: the condition that returns true when satisfied

params.name: failureMessage
params.comment: the message to print upon the timeout being reached

throws.comment: if the condition is not met within the timeout period

methods.name: waitForCondition
methods.comment: Waits for the given condition to return true

params.name: condition
params.comment: the condition that returns true when satisfied

params.name: failureMessageSupplier
params.comment:
the function that will supply the failure message in the
        event of a timeout.

throws.comment: if the condition is not met within the timeout period

methods.javadoc:
Waits for the given condition to return true. Most of the waitForCondition() methods throw an {@link AssertionFailedError} if the timeout period expires. This method allows you to setup a longer wait period by repeatedly calling this method.

Most clients should use {@link #waitForCondition(BooleanSupplier)}. @param supplier the supplier that returns true when satisfied
methods.name: waitForConditionWithoutFailing
methods.comment:
Waits for the given condition to return true.  Most of the waitForCondition()
 methods throw an AssertionFailedError if the timeout period expires.
  This method allows you to setup a longer wait period by repeatedly calling this method.

 Most clients should use #waitForCondition(BooleanSupplier).

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier that returns true when satisfied

methods.name: waitFor
methods.comment:
Waits for the value returned by the supplier to be non-null, throwing an exception if
 that does not happen by the default timeout.

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier of the value

params.name: failureMessage
params.comment: the message to print upon the timeout being reached

methods.name: waitFor
methods.comment:
Waits for the value returned by the supplier to be non-null, throwing an exception if
 that does not happen by the default timeout.

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier of the value

methods.name: waitForValue
methods.comment:
Waits for the value returned by the supplier to be non-null, throwing an exception if
 that does not happen by the default timeout.

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier of the value

methods.name: waitForValueWithoutFailing
methods.comment:
Waits for the value returned by the supplier to be non-null.  If the timeout period
 expires, then null will be returned.   Most of the waitXyz() methods
 throw an AssertionFailedError if the timeout period expires.  This method allows
 you to setup a longer wait period by repeatedly calling this method.

 Most clients should use #waitForValue(Supplier).

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier of the value

methods.name: waitForValue
methods.comment:
Waits for the value returned by the supplier to be non-null, optionally
 throwing an exception if that does not happen by the given timeout.

params.name: supplier
params.comment: the supplier of the value

params.name: failureMessage
params.comment: the message to print upon the timeout being reached

params.name: failOnTimeout
params.comment: if true, an exception will be thrown if the timeout is reached

name: AbstractGTest
comment:
A root for system tests that provides known system information.
 
 This class exists so that fast unit tests have a place to share data without having the
 slowness of more heavy weight concepts like Application, logging, etc.
 
 						!!	WARNING  !!
 This test is meant to initialize quickly.  All file I/O should be avoided.
